clinical_study.brief_title: High Dose Bupropion for Smoking Cessation
clinical_study.official_title: High Dose Bupropion Treatment for Smoking Cessation

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the benefit of administering Bupropion XL (BUP-XL) to heavy smokers who also experience psychiatric symptoms.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be randomly assigned to either receive 300 mg of BUP-XL or 450 mg of BUP-XL with an aim to quit smoking. They will take the medication for 8 weeks while simultaneously receiving counseling to set a quit date and stay motivated to quit. Medication will be administered for 4 weeks before and 4 weeks after designated quit-date. Post-treatment follow-up appointment will be scheduled for 8, 16, and 26 weeks post treatment so assess commitment to quitting and overall success of the study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomly assigned to receive either 300 or 450 mg of Bupropion XL.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participant will be unaware of which medication condition they have been assigned to, the care provider will not know which dose of medication they are distributing.

intervention.description: Antidepressant that is also effective in smoking cessation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- smokes >= 10 cigarettes per day for >= 2 years
- has breath CO ppm >= 10 ppm on intake
- Age 21 - 65
Exclusion Criteria:
- Past year moderate- severe DSM-5 non-tobacco substance use disorder (4+ symptoms)
- Possible drug contraindications (Panic, bipolar, bulimia, anorexia, insomnia, suicidal ideation, alcohol withdrawal, seizures, severe hypertension, renal/hepatic impairment, angle closure glaucoma)
- current use of other cessation medication
- current use of e-cigarettes or other tobacco products > 2X/week
- history of bupropion use
- current anti-psychotic, anxiolytic, antidepressant, or psychostimulant medication use
- currently or plan to be pregnant or breastfeeding
